page.title: 15The Bookham Community Assoc.
page.content:
The{Bookham Community Association}was formed in 1948 in response to the 1944 Education Act which urged the forma_ tion of centres for adult education and community groups.
The prime movers in its formation were Mr&Mrs Harrison & Dr Waterfield was its 1st President. The acquisition of the Barn Hall enabled the BCA to affiliate village clubs and groups and to form its own.
Some early formations were: the Over 60's, Gramophone & Bowling Clubs & the Dramatic Society. In 1952, there were 20 clubs; in 1985 there are over 60.
The original aims were to allow groups and people to meet and to work for the improvement of relationships and the general life of the village.
